intro: Orobus armenus, commonly known as the Armenian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or violet, with five petals and a prominent tube, blooming in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or forested areas.
